data: Complementary and alternative medicine (CAM) use by US adults increased substantially between 1990 and 1997, yet, little is known about more recent trends. This research shows that the prevalence of CAM use has remained stable from 1997 to 2002. Over one in three respondents used CAM in the past year, representing about 72 million US adults.
Trends in use of complementary and alternative medicine by US adults: 1997-2002
Hilary A Tindle and Roger B Davis and Russell S Phillips and David M Eisenberg
